predictions.text: U.S. JOLTS Job Openings (total, SA) for September 2025 will print between 7.2 million and 7.6 million.
predictions.verification_criteria: BLS JOLTS news release or FRED series JTSJOL for September 2025 shows seasonally adjusted total job openings level within 7.2–7.6 million.
evidence: Labor market cooling signals (slower wage growth, softer hiring plans).
Prior months showed gradual easing in openings relative to 2023 highs.
monitoring_signals: Indeed and LinkUp job postings trends
predictions.rationale: Openings have trended lower, but remain elevated; gradual normalization likely continues into September.

predictions.text: ISM Manufacturing New Orders Index for October 2025 will print between 49.0 and 52.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: Institute for Supply Management Report On Business lists October 2025 Manufacturing New Orders index value within 49.0–52.0.
evidence: Headline ISM hovering near 50 amid mixed demand.
Regional Fed surveys show modest stabilization in orders.
monitoring_signals: S&P Global Manufacturing PMI New Orders
Philadelphia/Empire State Fed new orders components
predictions.rationale: Mixed growth and higher rates constrain capex; new orders likely near breakeven.

predictions.text: University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment (preliminary) for November 2025 will print between 64.0 and 68.0.
predictions.verification_criteria: University of Michigan preliminary November 2025 Index of Consumer Sentiment headline range 64.0–68.0 as published on umich.edu or press release.
evidence: Rates and gasoline prices remain elevated, weighing on sentiment.
Equities near highs and easing inflation provide some offset.
predictions.rationale: Sentiment remains subdued but stable as inflation cools and rates stay high.

predictions.text: ADP National Employment Report for October 2025 will show a change between +120,000 and +190,000 jobs.
predictions.verification_criteria: ADP press release indicates October 2025 private payroll change within +120k to +190k.
evidence: Softening hiring in small business segments.
High-frequency time-clock data point to modest growth.
predictions.rationale: Cooling, not collapsing, labor demand implies mid-range ADP print.

predictions.text: EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report will show at least one weekly build of U.S. commercial crude (ex-SPR) of +5.0 million barrels or more by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Any EIA Weekly Petroleum Status Report through 2025-11-30 shows change in “U.S. Commercial Crude Oil (Excluding SPR)” >= +5.0 million barrels week-over-week.
evidence: Refinery maintenance season can reduce runs, boosting inventories.
Import variability and timing effects can create large weekly builds.
predictions.rationale: Seasonal refinery outages and import timing increase chances of a large weekly build.

predictions.text: CME Henry Hub natural gas front-month futures will settle at or above $3.50 per MMBtu on at least one trading day by 2025-11-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: CME settlement price for NG front-month contract reaches ≥ $3.50/MMBtu on any trading day through 2025-11-30 (UTC).
evidence: Early-winter weather risk and LNG demand can spark short squeezes.
Storage near norms but sensitive to degree-day surprises.
predictions.rationale: Weather and LNG flow variability can trigger an upside test despite recent softness.

predictions.text: The S&P 500 Index (^GSPC) will close down at least 2.0% day-over-day on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Yahoo Finance or exchange data show a daily close-to-close percentage change ≤ -2.00% for ^GSPC on any UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
evidence: Event risk: ISM, jobs, CPI/PCE, earnings, and shutdown dynamics.
Volatility remains two-sided even with strong equity levels.
predictions.rationale: Macro catalysts and rates volatility raise the odds of a ≥2% down day.

predictions.text: USD/CNH (CNH=X) will trade at or above 7.3500 on at least one UTC trading day by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Yahoo Finance (CNH=X) or Bloomberg intraday data show USD/CNH ≥ 7.3500 on any UTC trading day through 2025-11-30.
evidence: China growth concerns and property sector stress support dollar strength.
Policy tolerance for gradual CNH weakness persists despite firmer fixings.
predictions.rationale: Macro headwinds and strong USD bias can push CNH to 7.35 despite managed moves.

predictions.text: By 2025-11-30, NVIDIA will announce via official press release or SEC filing an equity investment in Poolside AI.
predictions.verification_criteria: An NVIDIA press release (newsroom) or SEC filing explicitly states an equity investment in Poolside AI by 2025-11-30.
evidence: TechCrunch: Nvidia reportedly investing up to $1B in Poolside.
NVIDIA’s strategy includes minority stakes in AI ecosystem firms.
predictions.rationale: Reports suggest advanced talks; a formal announcement is plausible within weeks.

predictions.text: U.S. PCE Price Index (headline, YoY, SA) for October 2025 will print between 2.6% and 2.9%.
predictions.verification_criteria: BEA Personal Income and Outlays release shows October 2025 headline PCE Price Index YoY (SA) within 2.6–2.9%.
evidence: Disinflation trend persists; energy prices mixed but not spiking.
CPI/PPI paths imply PCE moderates with weight differences.
monitoring_signals: Energy price moves and healthcare adjustments
predictions.rationale: Underlying disinflation and base effects likely keep PCE YoY below 3%.

predictions.text: China Caixin Services PMI for October 2025 will print between 51.0 and 52.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: Caixin/Markit press release shows October 2025 General Services PMI in the 51.0–52.5 range.
evidence: Private-sector surveys have shown services resiliency despite weak property.
Policy support and holiday effects can buoy services demand.
monitoring_signals: Retail sales and credit impulse indicators
predictions.rationale: Services expansion likely continues, albeit modestly, given policy support.

predictions.text: NFIB Small Business Optimism Index for October 2025 will print between 90.0 and 92.5.
predictions.verification_criteria: NFIB press release shows October 2025 Small Business Optimism headline index within 90.0–92.5.
evidence: High rates and labor quality issues cap optimism.
Easing inflation and stable demand provide partial relief.
monitoring_signals: NFIB compensation plans and price plans
predictions.rationale: Range-bound sentiment reflects tight financial conditions with gradual disinflation.

predictions.text: Freddie Mac PMMS 30-year fixed mortgage rate will print at or above 7.30% in at least one weekly survey by 2025-11-30.
predictions.verification_criteria: Freddie Mac Primary Mortgage Market Survey (PMMS) national average 30-year fixed rate reaches ≥ 7.30% in any weekly release through 2025-11-30.
evidence: Mortgage rates unexpectedly rose ~20 bps after the Fed cut (CNBC, 2025-10-30).
Rates volatility and wider MBS spreads can lift PMMS prints.
predictions.rationale: Volatile rates and MBS spreads support a high PMMS print within November.
